eraseMarks.message: This will permanently delete all marks and tasks. This action cannot be undone.

eraseMembers.title: Erase Members
eraseMembers.message: This will permanently delete all members. This action cannot be undone.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.content: Welcome to the Edutrace application. This guide will help you understand how to use the various features of the app to manage your students, groups, and marks efficiently.

dataStaysLocal.title: Your Data Stays on Your Device
dataStaysLocal.description: Edutrace is a "local-first" application, which means all your data (attendance reports, marks, groups, student information) is stored directly in your web browser on your device, not on external servers.

privacyByDesign.title: Privacy by Design
privacyByDesign.description: Because your data never leaves your device, you have complete control and privacy. No one else can access your information unless you explicitly share it.

worksOffline.title: Works Offline
worksOffline.description: Once loaded, Edutrace works without an internet connection. You can view reports, add marks, and manage groups even when offline.

noAccountRequired.title: No Account Required
noAccountRequired.description: There's no need to create an account, remember passwords, or worry about subscription fees. Just open the app and start using it.

fastResponsive.title: Fast and Responsive
fastResponsive.description: Since everything runs locally on your device, the app is extremely fast with instant updates and no loading delays.

browserSpecific.title: Browser-Specific Data
browserSpecific.description: Your data is stored in your browser's local storage. This means if you use Edutrace in Chrome, your data won't automatically appear in Firefox or Safari. Each browser keeps its own separate data.

deviceSpecific.title: Device-Specific Data
deviceSpecific.description: Similarly, data on your laptop won't automatically sync to your phone or tablet. Each device maintains its own independent copy.

backupRegularly.title: Backup Regularly
backupRegularly.description: Since data is stored locally, it's important to regularly export your data (via Settings → Advanced → Export All) to create backups. If you clear your browser data or uninstall the browser, your Edutrace data will be lost.

sharingBetweenDevices.title: Sharing Between Devices
sharingBetweenDevices.description: To use Edutrace on multiple devices, export your data from one device and import it on another using the Settings menu.

browserStorageLimits.title: Browser Storage Limits
browserStorageLimits.description: Browsers have storage limits (typically several hundred MB). While this is more than enough for most use cases, be aware that extremely large datasets might approach these limits.

reports.title: Reports
reports.content: The Reports page is your landing page. Here you can see a list of all your uploaded Google Meet reports. You can filter them by date, group, or meet ID. Click on a report to view detailed attendance information.

uploadReports.title: Upload Reports
uploadReports.description: Drag and drop your Google Meet attendance CSV files into the designated drop zone at the top of the page.

searchFilter.title: Search & Filter
searchFilter.description: Use the search bar to find specific meets. Click on "Group" or "Meet ID" chips within the table to activate quick filters.

sortData.title: Sort Data
sortData.description: Click on any column header (Group, Meet ID, Date, etc.) to sort the table accordingly.

manageReports.title: Manage Reports
manageReports.description: Use the checkboxes to select multiple reports for bulk deletion, or use the trash icon on each row to delete individually.

viewDetails.title: View Details
viewDetails.description: Click the eye icon on any row to open the detailed view, where you can analyze participant duration and timelines.

centralizedHistory.title: Centralized History
centralizedHistory.description: A complete history of all your uploaded attendance reports in one place.

quickInsights.title: Quick Insights
quickInsights.description: Immediate visibility into participant counts and session dates.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: Automatic mapping of Meet IDs to Groups (once groups are configured), helping you keep your records organized.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.content: The Analytics page provides a visual overview of attendance trends. You can see charts and graphs representing attendance over time, by group, or by course. This helps in identifying patterns and issues early.

dashboardOverview.title: Dashboard Overview
dashboardOverview.description: The dashboard groups your meets by course (1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th) and "Other Meets". Click on a course section to expand or collapse it.

search.title: Search
search.description: Use the search bar to quickly find specific meets by name, teacher, or ID.

quickStats.title: Quick Stats
quickStats.description: Each card displays key metrics: Total Sessions, Average Duration, and Participant Count (Active/Total).

attendanceHealth.title: Attendance Health
attendanceHealth.description: Color-coded badges (Green > 75%, Yellow > 50%, Red < 50%) give you an instant visual indicator of attendance performance.

qrCode.title: QR Code
qrCode.description: Click the QR code icon on any card to generate a shareable link for that specific meet.

detailedView.title: Detailed View
detailedView.description: Click on any card to dive deeper into the analytics for that specific meet, including attendance graphs and student-specific data.

trendAnalysis.title: Trend Analysis
trendAnalysis.description: Spot attendance trends across different courses and groups.

performanceMetrics.title: Performance Metrics
performanceMetrics.description: Easily identify high-performing groups and those that may need attention.

efficientNavigation.title: Efficient Navigation
efficientNavigation.description: Quickly jump to detailed reports for specific meets directly from the dashboard.

groups.title: Groups
groups.content: The Groups page allows you to manage your student groups. You can see which students belong to which group, and manage their details. This is essential for accurate attendance tracking.

createGroups.title: Create Groups
createGroups.description: Click the "Add Group" button to create a new group. Enter the group name, course number (1-4), Meet ID (the unique code from Google Meet), and optionally assign a teacher.

searchFilter.title: Search & Filter
searchFilter.description: Use the search bar to quickly find groups by name or Meet ID.

sortData.title: Sort Data
sortData.description: Click on any column header (Name, Course, Meet ID, Members, Teacher) to sort the table. Click again to reverse the sort order.

editGroups.title: Edit Groups
editGroups.description: Click the edit icon (pencil) on any row to modify group details such as name, course, Meet ID, or teacher assignment.

generateQR.title: Generate QR Codes
generateQR.description: Click the QR code icon to generate a shareable QR code for the group's Meet ID, making it easy for students to join sessions.

deleteGroups.title: Delete Groups
deleteGroups.description: Use the trash icon to remove groups that are no longer needed. You'll be asked to confirm before deletion.

organizedStructure.title: Organized Structure
organizedStructure.description: Map Google Meet IDs to meaningful group names and course numbers for better organization.

memberTracking.title: Member Tracking
memberTracking.description: See at a glance how many students are assigned to each group.

teacherAssignment.title: Teacher Assignment
teacherAssignment.description: Associate teachers with groups for better record-keeping and filtering.

automaticIntegration.title: Automatic Integration
automaticIntegration.description: Once groups are configured, uploaded attendance reports are automatically linked to the correct groups, making analytics more meaningful.

easySharing.title: Easy Sharing
easySharing.description: Generate QR codes for quick access to meeting links, perfect for sharing with students.

students.title: Students
students.content: The Students page lists all the students in your system. You can search for specific students, view their attendance history, and manage their information.

searchStudents.title: Search Students
searchStudents.description: Use the search bar to find students by name, group, or Meet ID. The search is instant and filters results as you type.

filterByGroup.title: Filter by Group
filterByGroup.description: Click on any group chip in the "Groups" column to filter the table to show only students from that group. Click the X button to clear the filter.

sortData.title: Sort Data
sortData.description: Click on any column header to sort the table. Available sort options include name, groups, sessions, attendance percentages, average marks, and task completion.

viewAnalytics.title: View Analytics
viewAnalytics.description: Click on any Meet ID chip to navigate directly to the detailed analytics view for that specific meet.

bulkSelection.title: Bulk Selection
bulkSelection.description: Use the checkboxes to select multiple students. Select all by clicking the header checkbox. Bulk delete selected students using the "Delete" button that appears.

editStudents.title: Edit Students
editStudents.description: Click the edit icon (pencil) to modify student information such as name, email, or group assignments.

trackAttendance.title: Track Attendance
trackAttendance.description: View attendance statistics including sessions attended (e.g., 7/8), average attendance percentage per session, and total attendance percentage.

monitorPerformance.title: Monitor Performance
monitorPerformance.description: See average marks (5-point scale) and task completion percentages at a glance, with color-coded indicators (green > 75%, yellow > 50%, red < 50%).

comprehensiveOverview.title: Comprehensive Overview
comprehensiveOverview.description: All student data in one place, including attendance, marks, and task completion statistics.

multiDimensionalTracking.title: Multi-Dimensional Tracking
multiDimensionalTracking.description: Track students across multiple groups and Meet IDs simultaneously.

performanceInsights.title: Performance Insights
performanceInsights.description: Color-coded visual indicators help you quickly identify students who may need additional support.

attendanceAnalytics.title: Attendance Analytics
attendanceAnalytics.description: Detailed attendance metrics showing both average per-session attendance and total attendance across all sessions.

academicProgress.title: Academic Progress
academicProgress.description: View average marks and task completion rates to monitor academic performance alongside attendance.

flexibleManagement.title: Flexible Management
flexibleManagement.description: Edit student details, manage group assignments, and perform bulk operations efficiently.

teacherExclusion.title: Teacher Exclusion
teacherExclusion.description: Teachers are automatically filtered out from the student list based on your settings, keeping the view focused on students only.

marks.title: Marks
marks.content: The Marks page is where you can record and view student grades. You can assign marks for different activities and view a summary of performance.

uploadMarks.title: Upload Marks
uploadMarks.description: Drag and drop CSV files containing marks data. Files should be named with the group prefix (e.g., "CS-101_marks.csv"). If the group doesn't exist, you'll be prompted to create it.

gradeScaleSelector.title: Grade Scale Selector
gradeScaleSelector.description: Choose how to display marks using the dropdown: Default (raw scores), 5-Point scale, 100-Point scale, or ECTS grades. The conversion is automatic.

searchFilter.title: Search & Filter
searchFilter.description: Use the search bar to find marks by student name, group, or task name. Click the "Filters" button for advanced filtering by sync status, date range, or specific group.

sortData.title: Sort Data
sortData.description: Click on column headers (Added, Student, Group, Task) to sort the table. Marks are sorted by creation date (newest first) by default.

syncStatus.title: Sync Status
syncStatus.description: Mark entries as "synced" (checkmark icon) once you've recorded them in your official gradebook. Unsynced marks show an orange pulsing dot and are filtered by default.

bulkOperations.title: Bulk Operations
bulkOperations.description: Select multiple marks using checkboxes and delete them in bulk. Use the select-all checkbox in the header for quick selection.

groupFiltering.title: Group Filtering
groupFiltering.description: Click on any group chip to instantly filter marks to show only that group. The active filter is highlighted with a ring.

viewDetails.title: View Details
viewDetails.description: Hover over any mark to see a tooltip with the full breakdown: raw score, percentage, 5-point scale, 100-point scale, and ECTS grade.

flexibleGrading.title: Flexible Grading
flexibleGrading.description: Support for multiple grading systems (5-point, 100-point, ECTS) with automatic conversion from raw scores.

taskManagement.title: Task Management
taskManagement.description: Track marks for different tasks and assignments, with task names and dates clearly displayed.

syncTracking.title: Sync Tracking
syncTracking.description: Keep track of which marks have been officially recorded with the sync status feature, preventing duplicate entries.

comprehensiveSearch.title: Comprehensive Search
comprehensiveSearch.description: Find specific marks quickly by searching across students, groups, and task names simultaneously.

advancedFiltering.title: Advanced Filtering
advancedFiltering.description: Filter by sync status (unsynced/all), date range, or specific groups to focus on what matters.

automaticIntegration.title: Automatic Integration
automaticIntegration.description: Marks are automatically linked to students and groups, appearing in student profiles and analytics.

visualClarity.title: Visual Clarity
visualClarity.description: Color-coded marks and clear visual indicators (sync dots, tooltips) make it easy to understand the data at a glance.

bulkManagement.title: Bulk Management
bulkManagement.description: Efficiently manage large numbers of marks with bulk selection and deletion capabilities.

settings.title: Settings
settings.content: The Settings modal allows you to configure the application to your needs. You can manage data, set preferences, and customize the application behavior.

generalLanguage.title: General Tab - Language
generalLanguage.description: Select your preferred language (English or Ukrainian). The entire interface will update immediately to reflect your choice.

generalTeacher.title: General Tab - Default Teacher
generalTeacher.description: Set a default teacher name that will be pre-filled when creating new groups, saving you time on repetitive data entry.

generalDuration.title: General Tab - Duration Limit
generalDuration.description: Set the maximum session duration (in minutes) for attendance tracking. Default is 75 minutes. Use "Apply to All" to update all existing meets with this limit.

generalTeachers.title: General Tab - Teachers
generalTeachers.description: Click "Manage Teachers" to open a modal where you can select which participants should be excluded from student lists and statistics. Add teachers manually or select from existing participants.

dataManagement.title: Data Management Tab
dataManagement.description: Manage your data by entity type (Reports, Groups, Marks, Members). Each card shows the record count and memory usage, with options to Export (download as JSON), Import (restore from JSON), or Erase (permanently delete).

advancedGlobal.title: Advanced Tab - Global Operations
advancedGlobal.description: Perform operations on all data at once. Export All creates a complete backup, Import All restores from backup, and Erase All permanently deletes everything (use with caution!).

dataBackup.title: Data Backup Strategy
dataBackup.description: Regularly export your data to create backups. Use entity-specific exports for targeted backups or "Export All" for complete system backups.

importData.title: Import Data
importData.description: When importing, you'll be asked to confirm as it will replace existing data. Make sure you have a backup before importing.

multiLanguage.title: Multi-Language Support
multiLanguage.description: Switch between English and Ukrainian with instant UI updates, making the app accessible to diverse users.

customizableDefaults.title: Customizable Defaults
customizableDefaults.description: Set default values for teacher names and session durations to streamline your workflow.

teacherFiltering.title: Teacher Filtering
teacherFiltering.description: Automatically exclude teachers from student lists and statistics, keeping your data focused on actual students.

dataPortability.title: Data Portability
dataPortability.description: Export and import data in JSON format, enabling easy backups, data migration, and sharing between devices.

granularControl.title: Granular Control
granularControl.description: Manage each data type (Reports, Groups, Marks, Members) independently or perform global operations on everything at once.

storageInsights.title: Storage Insights
storageInsights.description: See exactly how many records you have and how much storage each entity type is using.

safeDataManagement.title: Safe Data Management
safeDataManagement.description: All destructive operations (erase, import) require confirmation to prevent accidental data loss.

flexibleDuration.title: Flexible Duration Control
flexibleDuration.description: Adjust attendance duration limits globally or per-session to match your specific needs (e.g., different class lengths).

workspaces.title: Workspaces
workspaces.content: Workspaces allow you to organize your data into separate, isolated environments. Each workspace has its own set of reports, groups, students, marks, and settings, making it perfect for managing different semesters, courses, or academic years.

createWorkspace.title: Create Workspace
createWorkspace.description: Click the workspace switcher in the top-right corner (database icon), then click "Create New Workspace". Enter a name (e.g., "Fall 2024"), select an icon, and choose whether to copy your current settings.

switchWorkspace.title: Switch Workspaces
switchWorkspace.description: Click the workspace switcher to see all your workspaces. Click on any workspace to switch to it. The currently active workspace is highlighted with a checkmark.

iconSelection.title: Icon Selection
iconSelection.description: When creating a workspace, choose from 24 different icons to visually distinguish your workspaces. Icons appear in the switcher and help you quickly identify which workspace you're in.

copySettings.title: Copy Settings
copySettings.description: When creating a new workspace, you can optionally copy your current workspace's settings (duration limit, default teacher, ignored users). This saves time when setting up similar environments.

deleteWorkspace.title: Delete Workspace
deleteWorkspace.description: Hover over a workspace in the switcher and click the trash icon. You'll need to type the workspace name to confirm deletion. Note: The default workspace cannot be deleted.

dataIsolation.title: Complete Data Isolation
dataIsolation.description: Each workspace maintains completely separate data. Reports, groups, students, and marks in one workspace don't affect or appear in another workspace.

settingsIsolation.title: Settings Isolation
settingsIsolation.description: Each workspace has its own settings for duration limits, default teacher, and ignored users. Changes in one workspace don't affect others.

multiSemester.title: Multi-Semester Management
multiSemester.description: Create separate workspaces for different semesters or academic years (e.g., "Fall 2024", "Spring 2025") to keep historical data organized.

courseSegregation.title: Course Segregation
courseSegregation.description: Use workspaces to separate different types of courses or programs you teach, preventing data mixing.

cleanStart.title: Clean Start
cleanStart.description: Start each new semester with a fresh workspace while preserving all historical data in previous workspaces.

visualIdentification.title: Visual Identification
visualIdentification.description: Custom icons make it easy to identify which workspace you're currently working in at a glance.

flexibleOrganization.title: Flexible Organization
flexibleOrganization.description: Organize your teaching data however makes sense for you - by semester, year, course type, or any other criteria.

easyAccess.title: Easy Access
easyAccess.description: The workspace switcher is always accessible from the top navigation bar, making it quick to switch contexts.

hero.title: About Edutrace
hero.subtitle: A local-first application for managing student attendance and marks, designed to streamline the process of parsing Google Meet reports and tracking student progress.

privacyFirst.title: Privacy First
privacyFirst.description: Keep your student data completely private. All information stays on your device, never uploaded to external servers.

simplifyWorkflow.title: Simplify Workflow
simplifyWorkflow.description: Automate the tedious process of parsing Google Meet attendance reports and calculating student statistics.

accessibleFree.title: Accessible & Free
accessibleFree.description: No account required, no subscription fees. Just open the app and start using it immediately.

offlineCapable.title: Offline Capable
offlineCapable.description: Work without internet connection. All data is stored locally in your browser using IndexedDB.

vue.name: Vue 3
vue.description: Progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces

vite.name: Vite
vite.description: Next-generation frontend build tool for fast development

tailwind.name: Tailwind CSS
tailwind.description: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid UI development

router.name: Vue Router
router.description: Official routing library for Vue.js applications

idb.name: IDB (IndexedDB)
idb.description: Promise-based wrapper for browser IndexedDB storage

papaparse.name: PapaParse
papaparse.description: Powerful CSV parser for parsing Google Meet reports

lucide.name: Lucide Vue
lucide.description: Beautiful & consistent icon library for Vue applications

vueuse.name: VueUse
vueuse.description: Collection of essential Vue composition utilities

guide.title: Need Help?
guide.description: Check out our comprehensive guide to learn how to use all features of Edutrace effectively.

openSource.title: Open Source
openSource.description: Edutrace is open source and available on GitHub. Contributions, bug reports, and feature requests are welcome!
